medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a sharp, severe abdominal pain starting at 5am yesterday that woke him from sleep, resolving spontaneously after 30 minutes. A few hours later, while playing golf, the patient had a recurrence of the same pain, now more severe and persistent, accompanied by chills, intermittent nausea, and a single episode of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. The pain shifted toward the epigastrium and right upper quadrant. The patient also recalls a similar episode of abdominal pain that occurred approximately 4 days ago.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for mother with gallbladder disease.
